26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_ARRAY_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_ARRAY_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include <reactphysics3d/configuration.h>
31 #include <reactphysics3d/memory/MemoryAllocator.h>
32 #include <cassert>
33 #include <cstring>
34 #include <iterator>
35 #include <memory>
36 
37 namespace reactphysics3d {
38 
39 // Class Array
43 template<typename T>
44 class Array {
45 
46  private:
47 
48  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
49 
51  T* mBuffer;
52 
54  uint64 mSize;
55 
57  uint64 mCapacity;
58 
60  MemoryAllocator& mAllocator;
61 
62  public:
63 
65 
68  class Iterator {
69 
70  private:
71 
72  uint64 mCurrentIndex;
73  T* mBuffer;
74  uint64 mSize;
75 
76  public:
77 
78  // Iterator traits
79  using value_type = T;
80  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
81  using pointer = T*;
82  using const_pointer = T const*;
83  using reference = T&;
84  using const_reference = const T&;
85  using iterator_category = std::random_access_iterator_tag;
86 
88  Iterator() = default;
89 
91  Iterator(void* buffer, uint64 index, uint64 size)
92  :mCurrentIndex(index), mBuffer(static_cast<T*>(buffer)), mSize(size) {
93 
94  }
95 
97  reference operator*() {
98  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex < mSize);
99  return mBuffer[mCurrentIndex];
100  }
101 
103  const_reference operator*() const {
104  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex < mSize);
105  return mBuffer[mCurrentIndex];
106  }
107 
109  const_pointer operator->() const {
110  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex < mSize);
111  return &(mBuffer[mCurrentIndex]);
112  }
113 
115  Iterator& operator++() {
116  assert(mCurrentIndex < mSize);
117  mCurrentIndex++;
118  return *this;
119  }
120 
122  Iterator operator++(int) {
123  assert(mCurrentIndex < mSize);
124  Iterator tmp = *this;
125  mCurrentIndex++;
126  return tmp;
127  }
128 
130  Iterator& operator--() {
131  assert(mCurrentIndex > 0);
132  mCurrentIndex--;
133  return *this;
134  }
135 
137  Iterator operator--(int) {
138  assert(mCurrentIndex > 0);
139  Iterator tmp = *this;
140  mCurrentIndex--;
141  return tmp;
142  }
143 
145  Iterator operator+(const difference_type& n) {
146  return Iterator(mBuffer, mCurrentIndex + n, mSize);
147  }
148 
150  Iterator& operator+=(const difference_type& n) {
151  mCurrentIndex += n;
152  return *this;
153  }
154 
156  Iterator operator-(const difference_type& n) {
157  return Iterator(mBuffer, mCurrentIndex - n, mSize);
158  }
159 
161  Iterator& operator-=(const difference_type& n) {
162  mCurrentIndex -= n;
163  return *this;
164  }
165 
167  difference_type operator-(const Iterator& iterator) const {
168  return mCurrentIndex - iterator.mCurrentIndex;
169  }
170 
172  bool operator<(const Iterator& other) const {
173  return mCurrentIndex < other.mCurrentIndex;
174  }
175 
177  bool operator>(const Iterator& other) const {
178  return mCurrentIndex > other.mCurrentIndex;
179  }
180 
182  bool operator<=(const Iterator& other) const {
183  return mCurrentIndex <= other.mCurrentIndex;
184  }
185 
187  bool operator>=(const Iterator& other) const {
188  return mCurrentIndex >= other.mCurrentIndex;
189  }
190 
192  bool operator==(const Iterator& iterator) const {
193  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex <= mSize);
194 
195  // If both iterators points to the end of the array
196  if (mCurrentIndex == mSize && iterator.mCurrentIndex == iterator.mSize) {
197  return true;
198  }
199 
200  return &(mBuffer[mCurrentIndex]) == &(iterator.mBuffer[iterator.mCurrentIndex]);
201  }
202 
204  bool operator!=(const Iterator& iterator) const {
205  return !(*this == iterator);
206  }
207 
209  friend class Array;
210 
211  };
212 
213  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
214 
216  Array(MemoryAllocator& allocator, uint64 capacity = 0)
217  : mBuffer(nullptr), mSize(0), mCapacity(0), mAllocator(allocator) {
218 
219  if (capacity > 0) {
220 
221  // Allocate memory
222  reserve(capacity);
223  }
224  }
225 
227  Array(const Array<T>& array) : mBuffer(nullptr), mSize(0), mCapacity(0), mAllocator(array.mAllocator) {
228 
229  // If we need to allocate more memory
230  if (array.mCapacity > 0) {
231  reserve(array.mCapacity);
232  }
233 
234  // All all the elements of the array to the current one
235  addRange(array);
236  }
237 
239  ~Array() {
240 
241  // If elements have been allocated
242  if (mCapacity > 0) {
243 
244  // Clear the array
245  clear(true);
246  }
247  }
248 
250  void reserve(uint64 capacity) {
251 
252  if (capacity <= mCapacity) return;
253 
254  // Allocate memory for the new array
255  void* newMemory = mAllocator.allocate(capacity * sizeof(T));
256  T* destination = static_cast<T*>(newMemory);
257 
258  if (mBuffer != nullptr) {
259 
260  if (mSize > 0) {
261 
262  // Copy the elements to the new allocated memory location
263  std::uninitialized_copy(mBuffer, mBuffer + mSize, destination);
264 
265  // Destruct the previous items
266  for (uint64 i=0; i<mSize; i++) {
267  mBuffer[i].~T();
268  }
269  }
270 
271  // Release the previously allocated memory
272  mAllocator.release(mBuffer, mCapacity * sizeof(T));
273  }
274 
275  mBuffer = destination;
276  assert(mBuffer != nullptr);
277 
278  mCapacity = capacity;
279  }
280 
282  void add(const T& element) {
283 
284  // If we need to allocate more memory
285  if (mSize == mCapacity) {
286  reserve(mCapacity == 0 ? 1 : mCapacity * 2);
287  }
288 
289  // Use the constructor to construct the element
290  new (reinterpret_cast<void*>(mBuffer + mSize)) T(element);
291 
292  mSize++;
293  }
294 
296  template<typename...Ts>
297  void emplace(Ts&&... args) {
298 
299  // If we need to allocate more memory
300  if (mSize == mCapacity) {
301  reserve(mCapacity == 0 ? 1 : mCapacity * 2);
302  }
303 
304  // Construct the element directly at its location in the array
305  new (reinterpret_cast<void*>(mBuffer + mSize)) T(std::forward<Ts>(args)...);
306 
307  mSize++;
308  }
309 
311  void addWithoutInit(uint64 nbElements) {
312 
313  // If we need to allocate more memory
314  if ((mSize + nbElements) > mCapacity) {
315  reserve(mCapacity == 0 ? nbElements : (mCapacity + nbElements) * 2);
316  }
317 
318  mSize += nbElements;
319  }
320 
324  Iterator find(const T& element) {
325 
326  for (uint64 i=0; i<mSize; i++) {
327  if (element == mBuffer[i]) {
328  return Iterator(mBuffer, i, mSize);
329  }
330  }
331 
332  return end();
333  }
334 
336  Iterator remove(const T& element) {
337  return remove(find(element));
338  }
339 
342  Iterator remove(const Iterator& it) {
343  assert(it.mBuffer == mBuffer);
344  return removeAt(it.mCurrentIndex);
345  }
346 
348  Iterator removeAt(uint64 index) {
349 
350  assert(index < mSize);
351 
352  // Call the destructor
353  mBuffer[index].~T();
354 
355  mSize--;
356 
357  if (index != mSize) {
358 
359  // Move the elements to fill in the empty slot
360  void* dest = reinterpret_cast<void*>(mBuffer + index);
361  std::uintptr_t src = reinterpret_cast<std::uintptr_t>(dest) + sizeof(T);
362  std::memmove(dest, reinterpret_cast<const void*>(src), (mSize - index) * sizeof(T));
363  }
364 
365  // Return an iterator pointing to the element after the removed one
366  return Iterator(mBuffer, index, mSize);
367  }
368 
370  void removeAtAndReplaceByLast(uint64 index) {
371 
372  assert(index < mSize);
373 
374  mBuffer[index] = mBuffer[mSize - 1];
375 
376  // Call the destructor of the last element
377  mBuffer[mSize - 1].~T();
378 
379  mSize--;
380  }
381 
384  void addRange(const Array<T>& array, uint64 startIndex = 0) {
385 
386  assert(startIndex <= array.size());
387 
388  // If we need to allocate more memory
389  if (mSize + (array.size() - startIndex) > mCapacity) {
390 
391  // Allocate memory
392  reserve(mSize + array.size() - startIndex);
393  }
394 
395  // Add the elements of the array to the current one
396  for(uint64 i=startIndex; i<array.size(); i++) {
397 
398  new (reinterpret_cast<void*>(mBuffer + mSize)) T(array[i]);
399  mSize++;
400  }
401  }
402 
404  void clear(bool releaseMemory = false) {
405 
406  // Call the destructor of each element
407  for (uint64 i=0; i < mSize; i++) {
408  mBuffer[i].~T();
409  }
410 
411  mSize = 0;
412 
413  // If we need to release all the allocated memory
414  if (releaseMemory && mCapacity > 0) {
415 
416  // Release the memory allocated on the heap
417  mAllocator.release(mBuffer, mCapacity * sizeof(T));
418 
419  mBuffer = nullptr;
420  mCapacity = 0;
421  }
422  }
423 
425  uint64 size() const {
426  return mSize;
427  }
428 
430  uint64 capacity() const {
431  return mCapacity;
432  }
433 
435  T& operator[](const uint64 index) {
436  assert(index >= 0 && index < mSize);
437  return mBuffer[index];
438  }
439 
441  const T& operator[](const uint64 index) const {
442  assert(index >= 0 && index < mSize);
443  return mBuffer[index];
444  }
445 
447  bool operator==(const Array<T>& array) const {
448 
449  if (mSize != array.mSize) return false;
450 
451  for (uint64 i=0; i < mSize; i++) {
452  if (mBuffer[i] != array[i]) {
453  return false;
454  }
455  }
456 
457  return true;
458  }
459 
461  bool operator!=(const Array<T>& array) const {
462 
463  return !((*this) == array);
464  }
465 
467  Array<T>& operator=(const Array<T>& array) {
468 
469  if (this != &array) {
470 
471  // Clear all the elements
472  clear();
473 
474  // Add all the elements of the array to the current one
475  addRange(array);
476  }
477 
478  return *this;
479  }
480 
482  Iterator begin() const {
483  return Iterator(mBuffer, 0, mSize);
484  }
485 
487  Iterator end() const {
488  return Iterator(mBuffer, mSize, mSize);
489  }
490 };
491 
492 }
493 
494 #endif
